">Hololens demonstration at E3</a>, and that was reason enough for JoePatrick to create some animations of how he thinks KSP would work with the Hololens. [Edit: Snippity snerp.]

Still, though, this is really cool. Even though I'll likely never get a HoloLens, I really would love to see a HoloLens/PC hybrid in which the former just provides some information/visuals of landed craft and the latter can be used to play KSP.

...oh, and a message to the letter J at the bottom of this post: Don't think I can't see you hiding there, you scallywag!

-Upsilon

Edited June 19, 2015 by UpsilonAerospace

Awww, the music I made apparently didn't make the cut this time around...

For some reason this seems extremely rude and unnecessary and seems like blatant advertising. I also listened to that song you made and it immediately became clear why these videos were featured over it.

Edited June 19, 2015 by mythbusters844

Man, that technology! ( I am not old)

That has just blown my mind! I WANT ONE!!!!!!

For some reason this seems extremely rude and unnecessary and seems like blatant advertising. I also listened to that song you made and it immediately became clear why these videos were featured over it.

I'll delete the statement you quoted. Thank you for letting me know how you felt; it won't happen again.

That being said, I will say that there are much more polite ways of stating "I didn't like your decision there" than the statement that you made. I could easily argue that you were even more rude than I was. While I may have detracted from the chosen Fanwork Friday spot with my decision, I did so briefly and politely and then sincerely complimented the person on their work (I still think it's great). However, you used strongly negative terms to describe my post, stating that my work was far inferior to JoePatrick1's. Regardless of the quality of my work or my self-promotion, I trust that you will be friendlier in your future replies.

Thank you.

Back on topic, I will agree with some of the other replies in saying that just a few years ago, this would have been science fiction. Now, it's reality. And it's really cool.

-Upsilon

Back on topic, I will agree with some of the other replies in saying that just a few years ago, this would have been science fiction. Now, it's reality. And it's really cool.

-Upsilon

I know right??? It's sooooo awesome! Just imagine building craft with this using hand motion and getting a full 3D view of your craft!

That does look pretty cool, but I found the rover driving around the box a little, um, limited. I imagine the box will scroll as the rover drives straight. Now imagine the zoom out feature? Whoa!

I wonder how it'll be in the VAB/SPH?
Wow. Pretty cool stuff. I wonder why the videos are so short.

Wow. Pretty cool stuff. I wonder why the videos are so short.

Because they were 3D-graphic rendered, and unless you have a very powerful machine that can take a long time.

I know right??? It's sooooo awesome! Just imagine building craft with this using hand motion and getting a full 3D view of your craft!

Error code 404: fingers too fat for desired precision.

Well, although impressive technology, I don't know if KSP is very well suited for this. I saw the E3 presentation with a Minecraft world on a table top and that was very exciting, but, and I admit I don't know enough about it yet, as long as you can't make your whole living room the universe and fly through there I don't see the merit of it for KSP.

Greets,

Jan
Hololens is already pretty amazing! This will make it 10x better! I just hope that hololens is what they show...
I would get hololens just for that.
Yo, Squad, make HoloLens KSP a reality!
